# An overview of `git`

## What is `git`?

<img src="https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/git.png">

<aside class="notes">
* git is a system for version control
* vc?
  * ever created _v2, _v3, _vfinal, _vfinalfinal?
  * you have done vc
* git automates that, and more
</aside>

## Version control?

```
important_script.sql
important_script_v2.sql
important_script_v2_JIM.sql
important_script_v2_JIM_FINAL.sql
important_script_v2_FINAL_FINAL.sql
```

> [Excuse me, do you have a moment to talk about version control?](https://peerj.com/preprints/3159/) - Jenny Bryan, UBC

<div class="notes">
* _Critical_ for _clear audit trails_. 

* Manual VC = saving multiple versions, with a date, or your name, or some comment "FINAL"

* When collaborating, services will help manage. Dropbox on steroids (and KPMG approved!)
</div>

## What is `git`

* Free
* Built for collaboration
* Distributed
